channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: New Trump indictment filed in Jan. 6 case. And, how to watch the Paralympic Games
item.description: A new indictment was filed against former President Donald Trump over his efforts to interfere in the 2020 presidential election. And, the Paralympic Games kick off today. Here's how to watch.
item.content:encoded:
A new indictment was filed against former President Donald Trump over his efforts to interfere in the 2020 presidential election. And, the Paralympic Games kick off today. Here's how to watch.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Paralympics 2024: When, who and how to watch the Paris games
item.description: The Paralympics kick off in Paris on Wednesday and run through Sept. 8. Thousands of athletes from a record number of countries will compete across 22 sports. Here's what to know and how to watch.
item.content:encoded:
The Paralympics kick off in Paris on Wednesday and run through Sept. 8. Thousands of athletes from a record number of countries will compete across 22 sports. Here's what to know and how to watch.

(Image credit: Graham Denholm)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Israel launches large-scale military operation in the occupied West Bank, killing 9 Palestinians
item.description: An Israeli military spokesperson said the nine Palestinians killed in the operation were all militants, and that another five suspected militants were arrested.
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli military spokesperson said the nine Palestinians killed in the operation were all militants, and that another five suspected militants were arrested.

(Image credit: Majdi Mohammed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The movie 'It Ends With Us' faces criticism for glamorizing domestic abuse
item.description: Critics say the film, an adaptation of Colleen Hoover's bestselling novel of the same title, paints a love story — not a picture of domestic abuse as portrayed in the original work.
item.content:encoded:
Critics say the film, an adaptation of Colleen Hoover's bestselling novel of the same title, paints a love story — not a picture of domestic abuse as portrayed in the original work.

(Image credit: Justin Tallis)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Florida felons could get a bit more clarity on their voting rights with a new proposal
item.description: Florida election officials say they're working to “streamline” a process for formerly incarcerated people to figure out whether they're eligible to vote. It's something advocates have long asked for.
item.content:encoded:
Florida election officials say they're working to “streamline” a process for formerly incarcerated people to figure out whether they're eligible to vote. It's something advocates have long asked for.

(Image credit: Marta Lavandier)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: 'Institutional neutrality': How one university walks a fine line on Gaza protests
item.description: School is back in session, and the line between providing campus security and allowing for free speech is still extremely thin.
item.content:encoded:
School is back in session, and the line between providing campus security and allowing for free speech is still extremely thin.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Weird. Why the popular campaign insult stings more in Minnesota
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz popularized the term to brand his Republican opponents in the presidential race. To Minnesotans, though, it hits different.
item.content:encoded:
Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz popularized the term to brand his Republican opponents in the presidential race. To Minnesotans, though, it hits different.

(Image credit: Dana Ferguson)
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: Naomi Osaka's return to the U.S. Open earns her first top-10 win in 4 years
item.description: Osaka has won four major tournaments, including two Australian Opens and two U.S. Opens. She is making her comeback after taking hiatuses from the sport in recent years.
item.content:encoded:
Osaka has won four major tournaments, including two Australian Opens and two U.S. Opens. She is making her comeback after taking hiatuses from the sport in recent years.

(Image credit: Seth Wenig)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: 2 workers killed, 1 injured in tire explosion at a Delta Air Lines facility in Atlanta
item.description: Delta said the explosion occurred while wheel components were being disassembled for maintenance at a wheel and brake shop. The parts were not attached to a plane at the time, the airline said.
item.content:encoded:
Delta said the explosion occurred while wheel components were being disassembled for maintenance at a wheel and brake shop. The parts were not attached to a plane at the time, the airline said.

(Image credit: John Spink/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Biden pushed Gaza pier over warning it would undercut other aid routes, watchdog says
item.description: President Biden ordered a temporary pier be built to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza despite expressed concerns that the effort would be difficult to pull off, according to a USAID report.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden ordered a temporary pier be built to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza despite expressed concerns that the effort would be difficult to pull off, according to a USAID report.

(Image credit: Leo Correa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
